intro: Podanthum obtusifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf podanthum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and broad, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a houseplant.
